result.reason: Float window for undocked RDP tabs lacks maximize/minimize buttons despite FormBorderStyle.Sizable being set, because MaximizeBox and MinimizeBox are not explicitly enabled in FloatWindowNG
result.approach: Add MaximizeBox=true and MinimizeBox=true in FloatWindowNG.setDefaultProperties() to enable standard window chrome buttons on undocked float windows

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have a clear picture. The `FloatWindowNG` already sets `FormBorderStyle.Sizable` (line 26), `ShowInTaskbar = true` (line 29), and `DoubleClickTitleBarToDock = true` (line 33). However, the DockPanel Suite's base `FloatWindow` class may override or not expose maximize/minimize buttons properly. The issue is that when you drag-undock an RDP tab to a second monitor, the resulting float window lacks maximize/minimize buttons â€” it only has a close button.

The WndProc already handles minimize manually (lines 48-61), suggesting the base class doesn't expose the minimize box natively. The fix would be to explicitly set `MaximizeBox = true` and `MinimizeBox = true` in `setDefaultProperties()`.
